title: Meghan Markle's half-sister Samantha is at centre of US police probe into cyber bullying
text:
Samantha Markle, Meghan Markle's estranged half sister, is reportedly being investigated by police for online bullying.

The 54-year-old from Virginia allegedly wrote multiple contentious messages about the Duke and Duchess of Sussex online.

Complaints received by police came from no fewer than four countries including Canada, Sweden and the UK.

Samantha Markle, 54, Meghan Markle's estranged half sister, is being investigated by police for online bullying

Ms Markle's Twitter account was seemingly suspended earlier this year.

A Polk County Sheriff Department officer told The Sunday Mirror: 'There have been multiple reports of allegations of cyber-bullying made.'

The officer, who is working on the investigation, added to the paper: 'It is a large and widespread investigation and is likely to be a long process.'

No arrests have been made.

There is no evidence to suggest who made the complaints against Samantha Markle.

This comes after the Duchess of Sussex was moved close to tears as she told of her 'struggle' at being in the media spotlight in an emotional interview for ITV documentary 'Harry and Meghan: An African Journey

The Duchess of Sussex revealed she has found it difficult to cope after getting married and giving birth, adding: 'Not many people have asked if I'm ok'

The Duchess of Sussex's voice cracked as she revealed she has found it difficult to cope after getting married and giving birth, adding: 'Not many people have asked if I'm ok.'

On Friday, Samantha Markle branded her estranged half-sister Meghan a hypocrite for this statement and said she couldn't believe Meghan would have the 'audacity' to make such a remark given that she hasn't checked in on their father, Thomas Markle Sr, through his multiple health scares in recent years.

The latest investigation is not the first time a member of the Markle family has had a run-in with law enforcement.

In September this year, the Duchess of Sussex's nephew Thomas Dooley was detained by police after he was allegedly seen walking up and down a busy street yelling gibberish and wearing only a small towel - which fell off.

Dooley, 28, was charged with felony resisting arrest, with newly-released video of the incident showing him screaming expletives as several cops try to put him in the back of a squad car.
